alert.note: Alert for Central Blue Mountains; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 07 at 1:52PM PDT until July 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY COULD LEAD TO NEW FIRE STARTS... .A surge of Pacific moisture across the mountains of eastern Oregon may trigger isolated to scattered showers and thunderstorms Saturday afternoon and evening. While some of these storms could be wetting in nature, the lightning risk looks to be abundant enough to potentially trigger new fires, especially if strikes occur away from the thunderstorm core. Low RHs and continued heat will also exacerbate conditions for new fire starts and spreads. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES OR642 AND OR644... The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a Red Flag Warning for abundant lightning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 11 PM PDT Saturday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 642 Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains and 644 Central Blue Mountains. * IMPACTS...Lightning strikes may create new fire starts. * THUNDERSTORMS...Storms are most likely to occur within an area encompassing the John Day/Ochoco Highlands, spreading northeastward up to through the eastern mountains of Oregon. A lesser chance of storms exists over central Oregon and its adjacent mountains. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic winds up to 40 mph will be possible within storms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central Blue Mountains; Southern Blue and Strawberry Mountains
